power.title: Action Point
power.fluff: Digging into hidden reserves, you accomplish more than normally possible

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can take an additional standard action.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Unless another ability tells you otherwise, you can only spend an action point on your own turn, and cannot use it to interrupt an action.

power.title: Aid Another
power.fluff: You cooperate with an ally to provide assistance

section.name: Check:
section.text: Skill check or ability check vs. DC
The DC is usually 10 + one-half the challenge's level. If the challenge's level is not known, use an Easy DC of the acting character's level.

section.name: Target:
section.text: One ally designated as the lead

section.name: Success:
section.text: The target gains a +2 bonus the assisted check. For most checks, the check must be started before the start of your next turn, and if it takes more than one action to complete, you must remain engaged for the target to retain the bonus.

section.name: Failure:
section.text: The target takes a -1 penalty to the assisted check. For some checks, the penalty can be avoided if the check is not started before the start of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Usually, up to four creatures can use aid another to assist in a single check. In certain circumstances, the DM might decide that more or fewer creatures can assist. For example, only one creature can usually assist in picking a lock.

power.title: Aid Attack
power.fluff: You feint or distract an enemy, or otherwise help an ally's attack

section.name: Target:
section.text: One enemy, and one ally that can see or hear you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target ally gains a +2 bonus to his or her next attack roll against the target enemy. This attack must come before the end of his or her next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Usually, up to four creatures can use aid attack to assist in a single attack. A given creature can only aid a given attack once.

power.title: Aid Defense
power.fluff: You parry or shield block an enemy, or otherwise help an ally's defense

section.name: Target:
section.text: One enemy, and one ally that can see or hear you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target ally gains a +2 bonus to all his or her defenses against the target enemy's next attack against it. This attack must come before the start of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Usually, up to four creatures can use aid defense to assist against a single attack. A given creature can only aid against given attack once.

power.title: Basic Attack (melee)
power.fluff: You resort to the simple strike you first learned when you picked up a melee weapon

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage.

power.title: Basic Attack (ranged)
power.fluff: You resort to the simple attack you first learned when you picked up a ranged weapon

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Dexterity vs. AC, or
Strength vs. AC with a Heavy Thrown weapon

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, or 1[W] + Strength modifier damage with a Heavy Thrown weapon.

power.title: Break Object
power.fluff: You attempt to break an object with a well-placed kick or shoulder

section.name: Target:
section.text: One object
You cannot target items carried or worn by an unwilling creature

section.name: Check:
section.text: Strength vs. DC

section.name: Success:
section.text: You smash open a chest, burst bonds, force open a door, or otherwise break an object.
Smash wooden chest - DC 16
Smash iron box - DC 23
Smash adamantine box - DC 30
Burst rope bonds - DC 21
Burst iron chains - DC 28
Burst adamantine chains - DC 35
Break through wooden wall (6in thick) - DC 25
Break through masonry wall (1ft thick) - DC 35
Break down wooden door - DC 13
Break down reinforced door - DC 16
Break down barred door - DC 20
Break down iron door - DC 23
Force open iron portcullis - DC 28

power.title: Escape
power.fluff: You muscle or wriggle out of a grab

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be grabbed, or affected by some other ability that allows an escape attempt

section.name: Check:
section.text: Acrobatics vs. Reflex,
Athletics vs. Fortitude, or
Either skill against another specified DC

section.name: Success:
section.text: The grab or other effect ends on you, and you shift 1 square.

section.name: Special:
section.text: If you are grabbed by more than one creature or affected by other effects from multiple sources, you only make one check to end them all.
In such a case, use the highest DC and add +2 for each additional creature or effect, to a maximum of +8.

power.title: Grab
power.fluff: You seize your foe bodily to keep it from moving

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must have a hand free

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature that is smaller than you, your size, or one size larger than you

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: The target is grabbed by you until escape or until the end of your next turn, whichever comes first.
If you are affected by a condition that prevents you from taking opportunity actions (such as dazed or stunned), you immediately let go of a grabbed enemy.
If you move away from the creature you're grabbing, or if a pull, push or slide moves you or the creature you're grabbing out of your reach, the grab also ends.

section.name: Sustain Minor:
section.text: The grab persist until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Second Wind
power.fluff: You push through the pain and fatigue

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to your healing surge value.
You gain a +2 bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Another character can trigger your second wind as a standard action by succeeding in a DC 15 Heal check. You do not gain the bonus to defenses when second wind is triggered in this way.

power.title: Total Defense
power.fluff: Sometimes it's more important to guard against further injury than to attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a +2 bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.
